question: What is SEVC?
answer: Solar Electric Vehicle Championship is an electric vehicle design and racing competition providing a platform for engineering students to improve their skills and practical automobile knowledge.

question: Who can participate in SEVC?
answer: Students pursuing undergraduate program (any engineering department) in registered University or colleges affiliated to a university can participate as a team in SEVC

question: Will participants receive any training for design and fabrication from SEVC ?
answer: Yes, SEVC committee will conduct a series of workshops after registration for the teams. These workshops will offer both lectures and hands-on training for the students.

question: What is the use of participating in SEVC?
answer: In the fast-advancing world, Electric Vehicles will probably replace the existing conventional vehicles soon.SEVC Event enhances the knowledge of EVs and transforms them to capable engineers to get placed in core industries

question: When and Where can we expect the dynamic event to take place in 2023?
answer: Teams can expect the dynamic to take place in March 2023. The location of the dynamic event will be decided based on the voting of the participating teams.

question: How many teams can register in SEVC from one college/University?
answer: There is no maximum limit on the number of teams participating per college/University

question: If more than one team is participating from the same college/University, can the teams have a common faculty advisor?
answer: No, each team must have an exclusive faculty advisor, though they might be from the same college

question: Can one student captain, lead more than one team?
answer: Definitely no, each participant team must have a separate and exclusive captain, vice- captain, driver, co-driver and faculty advisor.
